alert.note: Alert for Northeast Bighorn Mountains; Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 02 at 2:01AM MDT until April 05 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 14 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Montana, Pryor/Northern Bighorn Mountains. In Wyoming, Northeast Bighorn Mountains and Sheridan Foothills. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. The cold and wet conditions could be dangerous for young livestock. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall will occur in Sheridan County, Wyoming.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
